textField: The *grammar-translation* method is a method of teaching foreign languages in which students are asked to learn grammatical rules and then apply those rules by translating sentences between the foreign language and their native language. It was commonly used in teaching *Classical Latin* and Greek, and then became popular in the teaching of *modern* foreign languages. It fell out of favour when more *communicative* approaches to language learning became widespread in the later part of the twentieth century.
